title: Ticket #1402: VM universe: issues with bridged networking
description:
There are several issue with bridged networking in VM universe job:
- when no XML helper is used, the generated configuration for KVM machines uses virbr0 but this interface, according to libvirt documentation (http://wiki.libvirt.org/page/Networking) can not be used for bridged networking;
- when no XML helper is used, the generated configuration for Xen machines does not contain any reference to the bridged interface (<source bridge="">).
- when the default XML helper is used, the configuration use 'br0', which does not exist by default
remarks:
2010-May-12 15:45:22 by rrati:
The usefulness of VM_BRIDGE_SCRIPT is questionable, at best, at this point. According to the config file comments, and the usage in condor, the script is intended to be passed to libvirt as the 'source script' for bridged networking. However, the source script is not used by libvirt for bridged networking and in the cases where 'source script' would be used (generic networking), it will not be able to be used by libvirt when VMs are run in unprivileged mode.

Additionally, VM_BRIDGE_SCRIPT provides a means to create a network interface, but not to tear it down. This seems of limited utility in a controlled environment. The libvirt docs talk about setting up the bridge interface on the host OS, and it seems a much more useful use case for the box admin to setup the bridged networking interfaces for a machine that will run VMs with bridged networking.

It is likely that VM_BRIDGE_SCRIPT is a hold over from before the libvirt conversion, when condor used the xen API directly. Additionally, dynamic interface creation and destruction could be handled, much cleaner, via the startd hooks.

Perhaps the job submit files should be allowed to specify which bridge interface to use, with the administrator able to define a default in condor's configuration, for a case where multiple bridge interfaces could exist on a startd. The creation of all the interfaces would be the responsibility of the admin (via hooks or explicit OS configuration).

Given all the above, it seems removing/deprecating the VM_BRIDGE_SCRIPT is the route to take, along with providing documentation on how to configure a bridge networking on the host.
